abstracts.cdata!:
The Emergency Desert Locust Control
            Project has two main objectives.  The first is to provide
            urgent assistance in support of Algeria's national
            locust control program.  The second is to further reinforce
            the existing surveillance and warning systems, enabling the
            country to better predict locust activity and movements,
            thus facilitating planning and implementation of future
            control programs in situations of both plague and recession.
            The early warning activities financed under the project will
            also benefit other countries in the region. The project will
            essentially consist of disaster prevention rather than
            disaster relief and the dealing with an existing emergency.
            The project consists of the following components:  (a) three
            locust control campaigns over the period February/March 1994
            to January 1995; (b) further strengthening national desert
            locust control capabilities by increasing the existing stock
            of vehicles, spare parts for vehicles, laboratory equipment
            for pesticide analysis, and health kits for the operators;
            (c) for prospection purposes, provision of small
            meteorological and mobile telecommunication equipment,
            including air to ground receivers and 10 hand-held global
            positioning systems; (d) provision of short-term consultancy
            and technical documentation to strengthen the capabilities
            of National Institute for Plant Protection in the safe
            handling, application and storage of pesticides, and
            disposal of pesticides and pesticide containers; and (e)
            training in locust prospection methods, pesticide handling,
            phytopharmacy and in pesticide-related environmental protection.
